definition: to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Partners are less likely to feel ignored or disrespected.
sentences.chinese: 同伴也不容易感到被忽視或者不受尊重。

sentences.english: Is your focus on productivity starting to make you feel miserable or stressed out?
sentences.chinese: 如果你追求效能時開始感到痛苦或是精疲力竭？

sentences.english: And Vergeer admits that "sometimes it's tiring always trying to improve.
sentences.chinese: 沃吉爾承認，“有時會對無盡的提高而感到厭煩。”
我爲這件事感到真抱歉，魚啊。

sentences.english: He felt browned off when he heard that he waw dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 當他聽到自己被解職時感到很不痛快。

sentences.english: She felt a bit comfortlessness to his licentious behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她對他放肆的行爲感到有點不舒服。

sentences.english: We enter the temple of the God of wealth will feel the feeling of beautiful decoration.
sentences.chinese: 我們進入財神廟便會感到金碧輝煌的感覺。

sentences.english: Is she disgusted that he would so soon betray Anna?
sentences.chinese: 她是否爲他對安娜如此之快的背叛感到反感？

sentences.english: In a moment, you'll begin to feel light-headed, then drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 馬上，你會開始感到頭暈，然後昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: I was embarrassed for her when she slipped and fell.
sentences.chinese: 當她滑了一跤跌倒時，我替她感到困窘。

sentences.english: Everyone feels resentment at being treated unfairly.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都會爲受到不公平的待遇而感到憤慨。

sentences.english: I had a feeling we were at Portsea for some special reason of hers.
sentences.chinese: 我感到我們到港海是有她特殊的原因。

sentences.english: He was abashed at forgetting his wife's birthday.
sentences.chinese: 他因忘了妻子的生日而感到羞愧。

sentences.english: A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough without ever having felt sorry for itself.
sentences.chinese: 一隻小鳥將自枝頭凍斃跌下來他未曾爲自己感到可憐。

sentences.english: You will feel helpless and the transience of life and helpless?
sentences.chinese: 你還會感到生活的無助和生命的無常與無奈嗎？

sentences.english: I am very proud of Aidan, we all are.
sentences.chinese: 我爲艾登感到驕傲，我們都這樣認爲。

definition: to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
